alert.note: Alert for Grays Harbor (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 28 at 10:25PM PST until March 01 at 9:10AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Satsop River Near Satsop affecting Grays Harbor County. Skookumchuck River Near Bucoda affecting Thurston County. .Heavy rain will continue through tonight before gradually tapering Tuesday morning, resulting in continued rises on rivers. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Satsop River Near Satsop. * WHEN...From late tonight to late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 38.0 feet, the Satsop River will flood low pasture lands and some roads along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM PST Monday the stage was 37.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will crest around 38.1 feet around 4am Tuesday morning. The river will fall below flood stage later Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 38.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Tuesday morning at 630 AM PST.
